taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Adults feed on worms, crustaceans, insects and plant matter (Ref. 7020).  Distinct pairs breed on densely grown weedy places (Ref. 205).  Consumed locally (Ref. 42843).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Orinoco, Amazon, Paraguay and lower Paraná river basins

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: South America:  Orinoco, Amazon, Paraguay, and lower Paraná River basins.
dataObjects.references: Garavello, J.C. and H.A. Britski 2003 Anostomidae (Headstanders). p. 71-84. In R.E. Reis, S.O. Kullander and C.J. Ferraris, Jr. (eds.) Checklist of the Freshwater Fishes of South and Central America. Porto Alegre: EDIPUCRS, Brasil. (Ref. 36801)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Widespread in South America: Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, Guyana, Peru and Venezuela.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.references: Mills, D. and G. Vevers 1989 The Tetra encyclopedia of freshwater tropical aquarium fishes. Tetra Press, New Jersey. 208 p. (Ref. 7020)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Environment
dataObjects.description: pelagic; freshwater; pH range: 6.0 - 7.5; dH range: 18

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#TrophicStrategy
dataObjects.description: Alimenta-se de vermes, pequenos crustáceos e insetos aquáticos
